official-title.#text:
To require the Food and Drug Administration to expedite review of pharmaceuticals that are approved
			 for marketing in the European Union.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speeding Access to Already Approved Pharmaceuticals Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speeding Access to Already Approved Pharmaceuticals Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 506 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:506

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, at the request of the sponsor of the
			 pharmaceutical, facilitate the development and expedite the review of such
			 new pharmaceutical under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505
Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:515

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 351 of
			 the Public Health Service Act

text.#text:
Beginning not later than 90 days after a new pharmaceutical is approved for marketing in the
			 European Union, the

term.#tail: means a drug (including a biological product) or a device.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subsection
			 (e) (relating to construction) of such section 506
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:506/ss:e

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is hereby moved so as to follow

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subsection (f) (relating to awareness efforts) of section 506 of the Federal Food, Drug, and
			 Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:506/ss:f

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4918 IH: Speeding Access to Already Approved Pharmaceuticals Act of 2014
